{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2017}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Dujon Sterling | image = Dujon Sterling 20180106.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Sterling playing for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in 2018. | fullname = Dujon Henriques Sterling{{Cite news |title=Dujon Sterling |url=http://thechels.info/wiki/Dujon_Sterling |publisher=TheChels.info |accessdate=20 September 2017}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1999|10|24|df=y}}{{cite web |title=Dujon Sterling |url=https://www.11v11.com/players/dujon-sterling-253783/|publisher=11v11 |accessdate=26 September 2017}} | birth_place = [[London Borough of Islington|Islington]], England | height = {{height|m=1.80}} | position = [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|Right-back]] | currentclub = [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]]
(on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]) | clubnumber = 17 | youthyears1 = 2007–2017 | youthclubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | years1 = 2017– | clubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2018– | clubs2 = → [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] (loan) | caps2 = 27 | goals2 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2014–2015 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 5 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2015–2016 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 8 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2016–2018 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps3 = 25 | nationalgoals3 = 1 | club-update = 13:08, 3 March 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 21:49, 26 July 2018 (UTC) }} '''Dujon Henriques Sterling''' (born 24 October 1999) is an English [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right-back]] for [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. ==Club career== ===Chelsea=== Sterling joined [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in 2007 at under-8 level and made his under-19 debut in a [[UEFA Youth League]] fixture against [[Sporting CP]] in December 2014. Although, recently Sterling has been deployed as a [[Defender (association football)#Wing-back|wing-back]], he has also been played as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] or [[Forward (association football)#Centre-forward|centre-forward]] and impressed during Chelsea's [[2015–16 FA Youth Cup]] campaign, netting in both the semi-final and final.{{Cite news |title=Manchester City 1-1 Chelsea: The FA Youth Cup Final (first leg) |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2016/apr/22/fa-youth-cup-final-first-leg-report |publisher=The FA |date=22 April 2016 |accessdate=20 September 2017}} Following an impressive campaign, Sterling was promoted to the U23 squad for the 2016–17 season as a 16-year-old and became a key figure, featuring twenty-four times and scoring four goals.{{Cite news |title=Dujon Sterling |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/teams/development-squad/development-squad/u21-player-profiles/dujon-sterling.html |publisher=Chelsea Official Site |accessdate=20 September 2017}} In October 2016, Sterling signed his first professional contract upon his 17th birthday. On 20 September 2017, Sterling made his Chelsea debut during their [[EFL Cup]] third round tie against [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]], replacing [[Davide Zappacosta]] for the final 14 minutes of the 5–1 victory at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]].{{Cite news |title=Chelsea 5-1 Nottingham Forest |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41249727 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 September 2017 |accessdate=20 September 2017}} ====Loan to Coventry City==== On 27 June 2018, it was agreed that Sterling would join newly-promoted [[EFL League One|League One]] side [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] on a season-long loan.{{cite news |title=Chelsea's Sterling in Coventry loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44635689 |accessdate=27 June 2018 |publisher=[[BBC]] |date=27 June 2018}} ==International career== Sterling was born in England and is of Jamaican descent.{{cite web|url=http://www.worldfootball.net/player_summary/dujon-sterling/|title=Dujon Sterling|website=worldfootball.net}} Sterling has represented England from [[England national under-16 football team|under-16]] to [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]] level. He represented [[England national under-17 football team|England Under-17]] at the [[2016 UEFA European Under-17 Championship|2016 U-17 Euros]]{{Cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2016/may/04/euro-finals-squad-announced-040516|title=England Under-17s squad named for Euro Championship|date= 4 May 2016 |publisher=The Football Association|accessdate=2 December 2017 }} and was included in the team of the tournament.{{cite web|title=2016 UEFA under-17 Team of the Tournament|url=http://www.uefa.com/under17/season=2016/technical-report/uefa-technical-team/index.html|publisher=UEFA.com|accessdate=2 December 2017}} In September 2016, Sterling made his debut for the [[England national under-19 football team|England Under-19]] team in a 1–1 draw against the [[Netherlands national under-19 football team|Netherlands]].{{Cite news |title=England U19 1-1 Holland U19 (9-8 pens) |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3769273/England-U19-1-1-Holland-U19-9-8-pens-Young-Lions-prevail-shoot-Everton-s-Tom-Davies-scores-Telford-friendly.html |publisher=Daily Mail |date=1 September 2016 |accessdate=20 September 2017}} In June 2017 he was selected to represent England at the [[2017 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2017/jun/26/england-u19-squad-for-euros-260617|title=England squad selected for UEFA European Under-19 Championship|date= 26 June 2017 |publisher=The Football Association|accessdate=2 December 2017 }} Despite Sterling scoring an [[Own goal#Association football|own goal]], England went on to defeat [[Portugal national under-19 football team|Portugal]] 2-1 in the final.{{cite web|title=European Under-19 Championship: England beat Portugal in final|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40619862|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 July 2017|accessdate=2 December 2017}} He was subsequently named in the team of the tournament.{{cite web|title=2017 UEFA under-19 Team of the Tournament|url=http://www.uefa.com/under19/season=2017/technical-report/uefa-technical-team/index.html|publisher=UEFA.com|accessdate=5 October 2017}} ==Career statistics== {{Updated|match played on 2 March 2019}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |+Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan=2|Club!!rowspan=2|Season!!colspan=3|League!!colspan=2|FA Cup!!colspan=2|League Cup!!colspan=2|Other!!colspan=2|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |[[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] |[[2017–18 Premier
